moves.1. Nc3 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 Ne4 4. Nxc6: Now my white-square bishop has some freedom, I attack the exposed f-pawn, and develop my bishop...
moves.8... f6: ...but my opponent moves the pawn out of harm's way.
moves.10... exd4 11. cxd4: ...and get the exchange, creating some space.
moves.11... Bg7 12. Re1: Now I start to develop a rook...
moves.15. Bg5: ...allows me to pin the rook down...
moves.17. exf5+: ...but I remove a pawn to expose the king...
moves.19... Kf7 20. Re4: Now I bring the rook into play...
moves.21... Kg8 22. Rc1: ...and bring my other rook into play.
moves.22... Bd7: He fails to cover his pawn...
moves.23... Ba4+: He moves his bishop out of harm's way, attacking my king...
moves.24. b3: ...so I block by bringing up a pawn.
moves.26. Rxd4: ...and I accept the gift of a bishop.
moves.26... Bh5+: He attacks me with his surviving bishop...
moves.27. f3: ...and again I cover with a pawn.
moves.29. Rf4: ...allows me to pin his bishop down. Not that he had much choice.

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do?
